intro: Oxalis cognita, commonly known as the purple oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are sometimes used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Oxalis cognita is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
